Posts.Content: Jul 30, 2013 01:40PM meirav wrote: In 2 days she will go through radio surgery( hopefully no new findings will be found on the preliminary MRI) She's had a tough week so far. Chemo(carboplatin - the plan changed from navelbine because of the high bilirubin levels) ,Radiation to the hip and Port installation. Her Oncologist said that most clinical trials don't accept people with brain mets in their recent history(3 months) hope this week is over with good results. thanks very much for sharing your treatments.

Posts.Title: Newly found brain and bone mets.on top of old liver mets. meirav meirav

Posts.Content: meirav wrote: Hi, well, my mom is out of the Xeloda and sorafenib clinical trial..she started with only liver mets and now, 9 months later we got another "gift"  newly found bone and brain mets. I'm a bit lost and would love your advice. 1.We're waiting for the MRI results to find out whether she needs "whole brain radiation" or focused sessions. What about cyberknife? anyone done that ? I read that this has fewer side effects but this costs a lot more. ( the regular rediation sessions are within our insurance) 2. The doctor wants her to start Navelbine transfusions.This is her second line in chemo.what is you experience with it? do you think something better is available? 3. CTC chemosensitivity test - http://www.rgcc-uk.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/02/CST-doctor-info.pdf of course, very costly, but our doctor ( as usual ) disregards it ( not enough evidence). Has anyone done it? Did it contribute to finding the right treatment? Is biopsy still a better option? 4. When is it the right time to start researching about the big cancer centers? MD Anderson and such. I need recommendations. We're from Israel. Thank you:) talking to other patients is the only way to get the real picture. Dx 8/2009, LCIS, 3cm, Stage IV, 6/11 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: meirav wrote: Hi, Things are getting worse. my mom's currently on Carboplatin and Gemzar , but her doctor is very indifferent and doesn't give her the treatment on time even though her blood allows it. Right now my mom's stopped eating anything other than Ensure. She is very weak and has jaundice.  One disgusting Oncologist told us that there are no other options other than Carbo and Gemzar(because most chemos dissolve in the liver and if it doesn't function properly they will remain in the body) and that he wouldn't have even prescribed them. A doctor who doesn't believe in his own practice. I ask for your advice. What should we do next? try checking local liver treatments? try to handle it naturally ( milk thistle and tumeric until things stable and then another chemo) Need your help! Thanks Dx 8/2009, LCIS, 3cm, Stage IV, 6/11 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Sep 27, 2013 09:41AM meirav wrote: Her Oncologist put her on Megace ( She is PR+ but another private Onc has told us that he thinks it's a waist of time) If her platelets count allows it we're going to ask her Onc to put her on Carboplatin again.She only had 2 treatments. PS I heard that there's a pill that can elevate the platelets count. best of luck. Ebru, there're trials for Everolimus + Aromazin that you might enter, if you've become hormone resistent. my mom was on such a trial for 10 months.
Posts.Title: Need your experience meirav meirav

Posts.Content: Jul 6, 2013 05:56AM - edited Jul 6, 2013 05:58AM by meirav Hi, well, my mom is out of this clinical trial..she started with only liver mets and now, 9 months later we got another "gift"  newly found bone and brain mets. I think she was on the placebo group, and after the doctor  lowered her dosage ( because of hand and foot syndrome) she couldn't elevate it again  because this was against the clinical trial policy.so we lost 2 months and we're now in a big mess. consider your options before going to trials and if you have a suspicion,don't hesitate to ask for all of the tests available.  DOCTOR doesn't always know best.
Posts.Title: Xeloda And Sorafenib meirav meirav

Posts.Content: Sep 19, 2013 02:17PM meirav wrote: She's been on Xeloda and this is only her second line chemo ( Carboplatin and Gemzar). Her mets are mainly in the liver. She had 2 small brain mets that she had SRS for and bone mets that were radiated ( the brain and bone mets are relatively new , she's only had liver mets over the last 3 years). waiting for next weeks carbo.hopefully it'll stable things and will allow us to seek more treatment as there are many. I think you should always investigate,mainly while feeling OK, because that's when most trials will accept you. right now PD-033291 ,micro rna and PD-1 look very interesting. (even if not for us,since we're from Israel and probably not eligible)

Posts.Content: meirav wrote: Hi, We got a recommendation from a second-opinion Oncologist to perform this costly test (about 4500$). My mom's very afraid of an actual liver biopsy and he said this might be an alternative. I checked with the company (that coordinates the submission of the test to a European company) and the test (taken from blood stream) results in: 1. A genetic mapping of the tumor cells 2. The potential impact of 60 available chemotherapies and biological treatments.   Has anyone done this ? Do you know about the prices of this test in the US?
